sense.name: occur, materialize or come about
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1 HAPPEN[intransitive] PP{P NP[topic]}
sense.examples: This is what's been happening in the energy spot markets. Who knows what will happen in the Middle East. Stuff happens. Whatever happened to poodle skirts and saddle shoes? His biography is full of events that may not have really happened.

sense.name: by chance, coincidentally
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1/Pro(IT) HAPPEN THAT SCOMP[finite] NP1/Pro(IT) HAPPEN SCOMP[nonfinite]
sense.examples: She happened to be standing in front of the bank when the robbery occurred. It just so happens that I have the tool you need to pick that lock. You didn't happen to see a red glasses case in the conference room, did you? He just happens to be the most famous tenor in the world!

sense.name: find, come upon, discover
sense.examples: We happened upon a diamond earring on our walk. If you happen upon Bob tomorrow, can you return this DVD to him? The chemist happened upon a new synthetic during some experiments.
